metro1500MainSerialNumber.name: metro1500MainSerialNumber
metro1500MainSerialNumber.description: Serial Number of the METRO1500 System

metro1500MainHardwareVersion.name: metro1500MainHardwareVersion
metro1500MainHardwareVersion.description: Hardware Version of the METRO1500 System

metro1500MainSoftwareVersion.name: metro1500MainSoftwareVersion
metro1500MainSoftwareVersion.description: Software Version of the METRO1500 System (Device Master).

metro1500MainBusMessages.name: metro1500MainBusMessages
metro1500MainBusMessages.description: Number of received internal Messages. This Number gives Information on the internal Activity of the METRO1500 System. This should be a large integer Number except when the System has just started. The Value is updated every five Seconds.

metro1500MainBusErrors.name: metro1500MainBusErrors
metro1500MainBusErrors.description: Number of dropped received internal Messages. This value should be 0 or a very small Integer.

metro1500MainLastEvent.name: metro1500MainLastEvent
metro1500MainLastEvent.description: Since SNMP Traps are not reliable, this Number can be polled periodically. The Value is set to a nonzero Integer when an Event occurs and cleared ten Minutes after the last Event.

metro1500MainMotd.name: metro1500MainMotd
metro1500MainMotd.description: Message Of The Day is the greeting when login via telnet. It shows the actual Kernel Version and the Software Update State. With the MOTD you get Information on the actual installed Software Packets.

metro1500MainTrapsinkAddress.name: metro1500MainTrapsinkAddress
metro1500MainTrapsinkAddress.description: IP Address of the Management System which should receive SNMP Traps. The Logfiles are also shown in this Table

metro1500MainTrapsinkCommunity.name: metro1500MainTrapsinkCommunity
metro1500MainTrapsinkCommunity.description: Community String which is sent with a SNMP Trap to the Management Station

metro1500MainTrapsinkPriority.name: metro1500MainTrapsinkPriority
metro1500MainTrapsinkPriority.description: Priority of the Trapsink (lower level gets less Traps)

metro1500SlotTable.name: metro1500SlotTable
metro1500SlotTable.description: Table of installed METRO1500 Components. Since METRO1500 can handle many different Components, in this Section only the common Information is displayed. Component specific Information is stored in different Subtrees.

metro1500SlotNumber.name: metro1500SlotNumber
metro1500SlotNumber.description: Slot Number of installed Component. The Device Master has always Slot Number 0 and is shown in the Main section.

metro1500SlotTypeNumber.name: metro1500SlotTypeNumber
metro1500SlotTypeNumber.description: Integer Number between 0 and 255 unique for a specific type of installed Component. This Number can be used for management Systems to handle automatically the different Options of installed Components.

metro1500Temperature.name: metro1500Temperature
metro1500Temperature.description: Temperature of installed Component in Celsius

metro1500BoardVoltage.name: metro1500BoardVoltage
metro1500BoardVoltage.description: Voltage measured directly on the board in mV

metro1500DetailInfo.name: metro1500DetailInfo
metro1500DetailInfo.description: A Reference to the MIB Definition where the special Options of the Component are described with more Details

metro1500EPLDVersion.name: metro1500EPLDVersion
metro1500EPLDVersion.description: Software Version on the programmable Logic Circuit

metro1500PSOn.name: metro1500PSOn
metro1500PSOn.description: Is installed Power Supply On or Off

metro1500FanOn.name: metro1500FanOn
metro1500FanOn.description: Is installed Fan On or Off

metro1500ConverterNumber.name: metro1500ConverterNumber
metro1500ConverterNumber.description: Slot Number of installed Converter Card

metro1500RxLoc.name: metro1500RxLoc
metro1500RxLoc.description: Local Receiver has Signal (On) or Loss of Signal (Off)

metro1500TxLoc.name: metro1500TxLoc
metro1500TxLoc.description: Local Transmitter is On or Off

metro1500TxLocC.name: metro1500TxLocC
metro1500TxLocC.description: Current of the local Transmitter in mA. This Entry is only available if a Current Sensor is installed

metro1500TxLocTemp.name: metro1500TxLocTemp
metro1500TxLocTemp.description: Temperature of the local Transmitter in Celsius. This Entry is only available if the Laser is cooled

metro1500RxRem.name: metro1500RxRem
metro1500RxRem.description: Remote Receiver has Signal (On) or Loss of Signal (Off)

metro1500TxRem.name: metro1500TxRem
metro1500TxRem.description: Remote Transmitter is On or Off

metro1500TxRemC.name: metro1500TxRemC
metro1500TxRemC.description: Current of the Remote Transmitter in Milli Ampere. This Entry is only available if a Current Sensor is installed

metro1500TxRemTemp.name: metro1500TxRemTemp
metro1500TxRemTemp.description: Temperature of the Remote Transmitter in Celsius This Entry is only available if the Laser is cooled

metro1500RxRem2.name: metro1500RxRem2
metro1500RxRem2.description: 2nd Remote receiver has Signal (On) or Loss of Signal (Off). (Only available if a 2nd Remote Receiver is installed)

metro1500ClockState.name: metro1500ClockState
metro1500ClockState.description: Status of the Clock. This Entry is only available if a Clock is installed. If the Clock is enabled, and has an error output, and cannot synchronize to the Signal, the Clock fails.

metro1500ClockFreq.name: metro1500ClockFreq
metro1500ClockFreq.description: Frequency of the Clock in MBit/s. Only available if a Clock is installed.

metro1500LocLoop.name: metro1500LocLoop
metro1500LocLoop.description: Local Loop is set to On or to Off

metro1500RemLoop.name: metro1500RemLoop
metro1500RemLoop.description: Remote Loop is set to On or to Off

metro1500ClockType.name: metro1500ClockType
metro1500ClockType.description: Type of the Clock. Only available, if a Clock is installed.

metro1500SwitchNumber.name: metro1500SwitchNumber
metro1500SwitchNumber.description: Slot Number of installed Remote Optical Switch Card

metro1500SwitchLine.name: metro1500SwitchLine
metro1500SwitchLine.description: Active Line of Remote Optical Switch

metro1500SwitchMode.name: metro1500SwitchMode
metro1500SwitchMode.description: Mode of Transmit Line of Remote Optical Switch

metro1500SwitchLaserOn.name: metro1500SwitchLaserOn
metro1500SwitchLaserOn.description: Shows if the reference Laser is On or Off

metro1500SwitchLineAavail.name: metro1500SwitchLineAavail
metro1500SwitchLineAavail.description: Is Line A of Remote Optical Switch available?

metro1500SwitchLineBavail.name: metro1500SwitchLineBavail
metro1500SwitchLineBavail.description: Is Line B of Remote Optical Switch available

metro1500EthernetHubTable.name: metro1500EthernetHubTable
metro1500EthernetHubTable.description: Table of installed FSP-II Hub Cards

metro1500EthernetHubNumber.name: metro1500EthernetHubNumber
metro1500EthernetHubNumber.description: Slot Number of installed Hub Card

metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity1.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity1
metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity1.description: polarity of input signal at Port 1

metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity2.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity2
metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity2.description: polarity of input signal at Port 2

metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity3.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity3
metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity3.description: polarity of input signal at Port 3

metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity4.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity4
metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity4.description: polarity of input signal at Port 4

metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity5.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity5
metro1500EthernetHubPortPolarity5.description: polarity of input signal at Port 5

metro1500TDMTable.name: metro1500TDMTable
metro1500TDMTable.description: Table of installed FSP-II TDM Cards

metro1500TDMNumber.name: metro1500TDMNumber
metro1500TDMNumber.description: Slot Number of installed TDM Card

metro1500TDMRxRem.name: metro1500TDMRxRem
metro1500TDMRxRem.description: Does the remote receiver receive Light (on) or not (off)?

metro1500TDMRxSync.name: metro1500TDMRxSync
metro1500TDMRxSync.description: Is the input signal synchronized with the corresponding TDM card?

metro1500TDMTxRemC.name: metro1500TDMTxRemC
metro1500TDMTxRemC.description: Current of the remote Transmitter in mA

metro1500TDMTxRemTemp.name: metro1500TDMTxRemTemp
metro1500TDMTxRemTemp.description: Temperature of the remote Transmitter in Celsius

metro1500TDMLocLoop.name: metro1500TDMLocLoop
metro1500TDMLocLoop.description: Loop for all Local Inputs enabled (on) or disabled (off)

metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData1
metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData1.description: receiving data for this module from the remote side

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency1
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency1.description: data rate of the clock installed on local Module 1 in MBit/s

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError1
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError1.description: data rate and clock frequency are not synchronized

metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData2
metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData2.description: receiving data for this module from the remote side

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency2
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency2.description: data rate of the clock installed on local Module 2 in MBit/s

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError2
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError2.description: data rate and clock frequency are not synchronized

metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData3
metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData3.description: receiving data for this module from the remote side

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency3
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency3.description: data rate of the clock installed on local Module 3 in MBit/s

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError3
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError3.description: data rate and clock frequency are not synchronized

metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData4
metro1500TDMLocModuleRemoteData4.description: receiving data for this module from the remote side

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency4
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFrequency4.description: data rate of the clock installed on local Module 4 in MBit/s

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError4
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockError4.description: data rate and clock frequency are not synchronized

metro1500HardwareAdded.name: metro1500HardwareAdded
metro1500HardwareAdded.description: Trap is sent when a new Module is inserted into the FSP-I Box

metro1500HardwareDeleted.name: metro1500HardwareDeleted
metro1500HardwareDeleted.description: Trap is sent when a Module is removed from the FSP-I Box

metro1500PSNotFail.name: metro1500PSNotFail
metro1500PSNotFail.description: Trap is sent when a Power Supply starts working

metro1500PSFail.name: metro1500PSFail
metro1500PSFail.description: Trap is sent when a Power Supply fails

metro1500FanNotFail.name: metro1500FanNotFail
metro1500FanNotFail.description: Trap is sent when a Fan starts working

metro1500FanFail.name: metro1500FanFail
metro1500FanFail.description: Trap is sent when a Fan fails

metro1500BusNotFail.name: metro1500BusNotFail
metro1500BusNotFail.description: Trap is sent when the internal Bus starts working again

metro1500BusFail.name: metro1500BusFail
metro1500BusFail.description: Trap is sent when an internal Bus Failure occurs

metro1500RxLocOn.name: metro1500RxLocOn
metro1500RxLocOn.description: Trap is sent when the local Receiver gets Signal

metro1500RxLocOff.name: metro1500RxLocOff
metro1500RxLocOff.description: Trap is sent when the local Receiver has Loss of Signal

metro1500TxLocOn.name: metro1500TxLocOn
metro1500TxLocOn.description: Trap is sent when the local Transmitter is switched on, Either this trap or Trap #20 should be disabled in the Configuration because they are typically sent at the same Time.

metro1500TxLocOff.name: metro1500TxLocOff
metro1500TxLocOff.description: Trap is sent when the local Transmitter is switched off, Either this trap or Trap #21 should be disabled in the Configuration because they are typically sent at the same Time.

metro1500RxRemOn.name: metro1500RxRemOn
metro1500RxRemOn.description: Trap is sent when the remote Receiver gets Signal

metro1500RxRemOff.name: metro1500RxRemOff
metro1500RxRemOff.description: Trap is sent when the remote Receiver has Loss of Signal

metro1500TxRemOn.name: metro1500TxRemOn
metro1500TxRemOn.description: Trap is sent when the remote Transmitter is switched on, Either this trap or Trap #24 should be disabled in the Configuration because they are typically sent at the same Time.

metro1500TxRemOff.name: metro1500TxRemOff
metro1500TxRemOff.description: Trap is sent when the remote Transmitter is switched off, Either this trap or Trap #25 should be disabled in the Configuration because they are typically sent at the same Time.

metro1500RxRem2On.name: metro1500RxRem2On
metro1500RxRem2On.description: Trap is sent when the 2nd remote Receiver gets Signal. This Trap is only sent if there is a 2nd remote Receiver.

metro1500RxRem2Off.name: metro1500RxRem2Off
metro1500RxRem2Off.description: Trap is sent when the 2nd remote Receiver has Loss of Signal. This Trap is only sent if there is a 2nd remote Receiver.

metro1500TxRem2On.name: metro1500TxRem2On
metro1500TxRem2On.description: Trap is sent when the 2nd remote Transmitter is switched on, Either this Trap or Trap #28 should be disabled in the Configuration because they are typically sent at the same Time. This Trap is only sent if there is a 2nd remote Receiver.

metro1500TxRem2Off.name: metro1500TxRem2Off
metro1500TxRem2Off.description: Trap is sent when the 2nd remote Transmitter is switched off, Either this trap or Trap #29 should be disabled in the Configuration because they are typically sent at the same Time.

metro1500ClockNoFail.name: metro1500ClockNoFail
metro1500ClockNoFail.description: Trap is sent if a Clock is installed and can synchronize with the input Signal. This Trap is not sent if the installed Clock does not have an error Output

metro1500ClockFail.name: metro1500ClockFail
metro1500ClockFail.description: Trap is sent if a Clock is installed and can not synchronize with the input Signal. This trap is not sent if the installed Clock does not have an error Output

metro1500ClockChangeFrequency.name: metro1500ClockChangeFrequency
metro1500ClockChangeFrequency.description: Trap is sent if a multi frequency Clock is installed and changes its frequency.

metro1500LocLoopOn.name: metro1500LocLoopOn
metro1500LocLoopOn.description: Trap is sent if Local Loop is set to On.

metro1500LocLoopOff.name: metro1500LocLoopOff
metro1500LocLoopOff.description: Trap is sent if Local Loop is set to Off.

metro1500RemLoopOn.name: metro1500RemLoopOn
metro1500RemLoopOn.description: Trap is sent if Remote Loop is set to On.

metro1500RemLoopOff.name: metro1500RemLoopOff
metro1500RemLoopOff.description: Trap is sent if Remote Loop is set to Off.

metro1500switchReferenceLaserOn.name: metro1500switchReferenceLaserOn
metro1500switchReferenceLaserOn.description: Trap is sent when the Reference Laser is switched on

metro1500switchReferenceLaserOff.name: metro1500switchReferenceLaserOff
metro1500switchReferenceLaserOff.description: Trap is sent when the Reference Laser is switched off

metro1500switchToA.name: metro1500switchToA
metro1500switchToA.description: Trap is sent when the Switch switches to Line A

metro1500switchToB.name: metro1500switchToB
metro1500switchToB.description: Trap is sent when the Switch switches to Line B

metro1500switchAutomatic.name: metro1500switchAutomatic
metro1500switchAutomatic.description: Trap is sent when the Switch is going to Automatic State

metro1500switchLocked.name: metro1500switchLocked
metro1500switchLocked.description: Trap is sent when the Switch is going to Locked State

metro1500switchLineAavail.name: metro1500switchLineAavail
metro1500switchLineAavail.description: Trap is sent when the Switch Line A is available

metro1500switchLineANotAvail.name: metro1500switchLineANotAvail
metro1500switchLineANotAvail.description: Trap is sent when the Switch Line A is not available

metro1500switchLineBavail.name: metro1500switchLineBavail
metro1500switchLineBavail.description: Trap is sent when the Switch Line B is available

metro1500switchLineBNotAvail.name: metro1500switchLineBNotAvail
metro1500switchLineBNotAvail.description: Trap is sent when the Switch Line B is not available

metro1500repeatedMessage.name: metro1500repeatedMessage
metro1500repeatedMessage.description: Trap is sent, after three times the same trap is sent (instead of the fourth one). The original trap is suppressed for one minute.

metro1500INNCDown.name: metro1500INNCDown
metro1500INNCDown.description: Trap is sent, when the Inter NEMI Network Connection (INNC) is down.

metro1500INNCUp.name: metro1500INNCUp
metro1500INNCUp.description: Trap is sent, when the Inter NEMI Network Connection (INNC) is up.

metro1500EthernetHubPortEnable.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortEnable
metro1500EthernetHubPortEnable.description: Trap is sent, when one of the ports of the Ethernet Hub is enabled by the management software (default). Use SNMP Get to get the Port Number.

metro1500EthernetHubPortDisable.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortDisable
metro1500EthernetHubPortDisable.description: Trap is sent, when one of the ports of the Ethernet Hub is disabled by the management Software. Use SNMP Get to get the Port number.

metro1500EthernetHubPortPartitioned.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortPartitioned
metro1500EthernetHubPortPartitioned.description: Trap is sent, when a Hub Port is disabled by the Hub Hardware. Use SNMP Get to get the Port Number.

metro1500EthernetHubPortNotPartitioned.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortNotPartitioned
metro1500EthernetHubPortNotPartitioned.description: Trap is sent, when a Hub Port is enabled by the Hub Hardware (default). Use SNMP Get to get the Port Number.

metro1500EthernetHubPortLinkPulses.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortLinkPulses
metro1500EthernetHubPortLinkPulses.description: Trap is sent, when a Hub Port starts receiving Link Pulses. Use SNMP Get to get the Port Number

metro1500EthernetHubPortNoLinkPulses.name: metro1500EthernetHubPortNoLinkPulses
metro1500EthernetHubPortNoLinkPulses.description: Trap is sent, when a Hub Port stops receiving Link Pulses. Use SNMP Get to get the Port Number

metro1500TDMRemoteSyncLoss.name: metro1500TDMRemoteSyncLoss
metro1500TDMRemoteSyncLoss.description: Trap is sent, when the synchronisation of the incoming remote data stream is lost

metro1500TDMRemoteSync.name: metro1500TDMRemoteSync
metro1500TDMRemoteSync.description: Trap is sent, when the synchronisation of the incoming remote data stream is established

metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled1
metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled1.description: Trap is sent, when local module 1 is enabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable1
metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable1.description: Trap is sent, when local module 1 is disabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled2
metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled2.description: Trap is sent, when local module 2 is enabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable2
metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable2.description: Trap is sent, when local module 2 is disabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled3
metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled3.description: Trap is sent, when local module 3 is enabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable3
metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable3.description: Trap is sent, when local module 3 is disabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled4
metro1500TDMLocModuleEnabled4.description: Trap is sent, when local module 4 is enabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable4
metro1500TDMLocModuleDisable4.description: Trap is sent, when local module 4 is disabled by software

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn1
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn1.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 1 of a TDM card gets modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff1
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff1.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 1 of a TDM card doesn't get modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn2
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn2.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 2 of a TDM card gets modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff2
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff2.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 2 of a TDM card doesn't get modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn3
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn3.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 3 of a TDM card gets modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff3
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff3.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 3 of a TDM card doesn't get modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn4
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOn4.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 4 of a TDM card gets modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff4
metro1500TDMLocModuleRxOff4.description: Trap is sent, when the local receiver 4 of a TDM card doesn't get modulated signal

metro1500TDMLocModuleData1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleData1
metro1500TDMLocModuleData1.description: Trap is sent, when data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData1
metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData1.description: Trap is sent, when no data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleData2.description: Trap is sent, when data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData2.description: Trap is sent, when no data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleData3.description: Trap is sent, when data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData3
metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData3.description: Trap is sent, when no data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleData4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleData4
metro1500TDMLocModuleData4.description: Trap is sent, when data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData4.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData4
metro1500TDMLocModuleNoData4.description: Trap is sent, when no data from the remote side is available for this TDM channel

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail1
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail1.description: Trap is sent, when the Data Rate of the local input signal doesn't match the Data Rate of the local clock

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail1.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail1
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail1.description: Trap is sent, when the Data Rate of the local input signal matches the Data Rate of the local clock

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail2
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail2.description: Trap is sent, when the Data Rate of the local input signal doesn't match the Data Rate of the local clock

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail2.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail2
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail2.description: Trap is sent, when the Data Rate of the local input signal matches the Data Rate of the local clock

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail3.name: metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail3
metro1500TDMLocModuleClockFail3.description: Trap is sent, when the Data Rate of the local input signal doesn't match the Data Rate of the local clock

metro1500TDMLocModuleClockNoFail3.description: Trap is sent, when the Data Rate of the local input signal matches the Data Rate of the local clock
